titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. James R. Whereas complaint hath been made to us by the postmaster general of this our kingdom of Ireland that divers abuses have been lately committed by several curriers, and others ryding post in this kingdom, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook the assign of Benjamin Took printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty and are to be sold at his Majesties printing-house on Ormonde Key.,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at our castle of Dublin the 30th day of November. 1689."
Concerning the post and the conveyance of letters. Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
